intro: Tetracera grandiflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often found climbing or as an epiphyte on trees, using its aerial roots for support. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
